Name: market for glued solid timber | glued solid timber | EN15804GD, U
Category: C:Manufacturing/16:Manufacture of wood and of products of wood and cork, except furniture; manufacture of articles of straw and plaiting materials/162:Manufacture of products of wood, cork, straw and plaiting materials/1621:Manufacture of veneer sheets and wood-based panels
Description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/23888/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This dataset represents the global market for glued solid timber.; Glued solid timber beams are industrially-manufactured products for load-bearing structures. They comprise two or three coniferous wood planks or squared timbers which are glued together by their face sides parallel to grain.;The manufacturing process corresponds with that of glued laminated timber, whereby larger individual cross-sections are glued together. Thanks to their manufacturing process, glued solid timber beams are very dimensionally stable and are only susceptible to minor cracking.;Owing to their high dimensional stability and low moisture content glued solid timber beams are particularly suitable for timber-frame buildings. glued solid timber beams are manufactured from spruce, fir, pine, larch or Douglas fir. Other coniferous species are permissible but not typical.;The standard strength class is C24 or C24M;Reference:;Kollmann F. F. P., Kuenzi E. W. and Stamm A. J. (1975) Principles of Wood Science and Technology. Springer-Verl., Berlin, Heidelberg, New York. AND Nimz H., Schmitt U., Schwab E., Wittmann O. and Wolf F. (1997) Wood. In:  Ullmann's encyclopedia of indus-trial chemistry (ed. Anonymous). 5th edition on CD-ROM Edition. Wiley & Sons, London.;Rüter, S. and S. Diederichs (2012): Ökobilanz-Basisdaten für Bauprodukte aus Holz. Arbeitsbericht aus dem Institut für Holztechnologie und Holzbiologie Nr. 2012/1, Johann Heinrich von Thünen-Institut (vTI), Hamburg. 

Activity starts with the product leaving the factory gate, ready for shipment

Activity ends with the reception of the product at the consuming entity. Average transportation requirements from producer to consuming entity are covered.
